document.heading: Procurement Practices Reform Exemption Amendment Act of 2014

history.narrative: Law 20-94, the “Procurement Practices Reform Exemption Amendment Act of 2014,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 20-152. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 3, 2013, and January 7, 2014, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 23, 2014, it was assigned Act No. 20-271 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 20-94 became effective on March 14, 2014.
